Topics: Q3.9.2. Does the Centre of government play a role in international co-operation on policies that require international coordination (e.g. monetary, fi
Please describe in more detail the CoG‚Äôs role
Data: Depending on the issue, different units of the COG take the lead on international co-operation on policies. For example, the National Economic Council (NEC) is part of the Executive Office of the President and has four principal functions: to coordinate policy-making for domestic and international economic issues, to coordinate economic policy advice for the President, to ensure that policy decisions and programs are consistent with the President's economic goals, and to monitor implementation of the President's economic policy agenda.

Additional challenges include:‚Ä¢	the lack of central capacity to work across agencies on areas needing cross-agency coordination to achieve outcomes.  ‚Ä¢	finding ways for the COG to incentivize leadership to focus on implementation, not just policy, budget, legislation and communication issues is a consistent challenge.  ‚Ä¢	integrating enterprise risk management and foresight into organizational cultures that often focus on more short-term issuesThings we are beginning to do well include:‚Ä¢	reaching agreement in 2010 on a new performance framework that adopted international best practices in performance management including setting clear expectations leadership engagement in setting goals, conducting data-driven reviews, and follow up actions.  We have established clear roles for Chief Operating Officers, Performance Improvement Officers, and Goal Leaders.‚Ä¢	Establishing a dedicated team (Performance Improvement Council) to sharing effective performance management practices across agencies (that is aligned with but separate from policy team).

Q3.7.1. Through what mechanisms does the CoG ensure that government policies are implemented by line ministries?

Data: DPME major focus is to ensure continuous improvement in service delivery through performance monitoring and evaluation.  It does this via:- Plans for the 12 priority outcomes (delivery agreements)- Monitoring (i.e. tracking) progress against the plans- Evaluating to inform improvements to programmes, policies, plans- Presidential hands-on monitoring- Focus on quality of management practices in individual departments - Moderated self assessment - Drive a process of continuous improvement- Link results to assessment of HoDs- Focus on monitoring of experience of citizens when obtaining services- Presidential hotline- Unannounced visits- Citizen-based monitoring- Develop capacity of national and provincial departments and municipalities to carry out M&E themselves- Develop a management culture of continuous improvement based on M&E- Address problems with data quality and information management- National Evaluation System
Evaluation and assessment of management practices

Topics: Workplan for the implementation of the Government Programme that sets deadlines for ministries to prepare particular proposals

Q3.9.2. Does the Centre of government play a role in international co-operation on policies that require international coordination (e.g. monetary, fi
Please describe in more detail the CoG‚Äôs role
Data: The President as the Head of Government and Head of State is responsible for international relations policy. Department of Coorperative International Relations and Cooperation provides technical support and coordination of this function accross government and in RSA's missions abroad.  Other ministers take responsibility for the specialised functions like climate change, water, housing, etc

The Presidency has increased its capacity to support government via DPME and that works extremely well.  National Planning Commission in the Presidency has released the country's first longterm vision and plan which is well received by key sectors in society.There is good collaboration with other administrative ministries like the National Treasury, etc.More still needs to be done in sregnthening integration of work in relation to coordination of intergovernmental programmes and accountability mechanisms as acknowledged by the NDP. Human Resources Management is key for building a capable and developmental state.
